thread.title: 8 horrendous Leicester stats which show just how bad the Premier League champions have been this season
thread.title_full: 8 horrendous Leicester stats which show just how bad the Premier League champions have been this season

author: Mark Jones
title: 8 horrendous Leicester stats which show just how bad the Premier League champions have been this season
text:
Sport 8 horrendous Leicester stats which show just how bad the Premier League champions have been this season The champions are having a torrid time of things, and as these stats show, things are only heading in one direction following the glory of last season Share It's all gone wrong for the champions (Photo: Reuters / Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Oh, Leicester . Leicester, Leicester, Leicester. What's happened to you? 
The world was in love with the Foxes this time last year as their remarkable Premier League title bid started to seem real. On Valentine's Day 2016 the Foxes were two points clear at the top of the table, but now they have fallen apart like a bad relationship. 
After their defeat at Swansea on Sunday, Claudio Ranieri's side are just one point and one place above the relegation zone, and they could theoretically be bottom of the division by the time they play their next league game against Liverpool on February 27th. You won't find the answers down there, lads (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) "It just doesn't feel the same any more, Wes" (Photo: Rex Features) 
There is a growing belief that we could be about to see the reigning English champions be relegated for the first time since Manchester City went down in 1937. 
And a look at these eight shocking stats won't make good reading for Foxes fans. Leicester are the first reigning top-flight champions to fail to score in six consecutive league matches "Hold me" (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) The Foxes have now gone 10 hours without scoring a Premier League goal Dilly ding dilly wrong (Photo: PA Wire) Leicester have conceded 15 goals in the 15 minutes before half time this season; the most in the Premier League Alfie Mawson and Martin Olsson added Nos. 14 and 15 on Sunday (Photo: Getty Images) No team in the top four tiers has won fewer points in 2017 than Leicester (one, level with Aston Villa, Coventry & Leyton Orient) Slimani didn't even get to enjoy last season (Photo: REUTERS) Jamie Vardy has failed to have a single shot on target in 513 minutes of Premier League action So Jamie, about that Arsenal move... (Photo: Stu Forster) Leicester are the only team in England's top four tiers yet to score a single league goal in 2017 Looking up would help (Photo: Getty) The Foxes remain without an away win in the Premier League since a 2-0 victory at Sunderland last April, and they are on a run of 15 away games without a win (D5 L10). Only once before in the Premier League have they had a longer winless away run, going 16 games without a win between December 2001 and October 2003. Foxes fans in happier times (Photo: Plumb Images) Last season, Jamie Vardy (10) and Riyad Mahrez (12) scored a combined 22 goals away from home in the Premier League â€“ this season they have scored three (Vardy on one, Mahrez with two) Have you seen these men? (Photo: Plumb Images) Can it possibly get any worse? poll loading
